dublinCore.dc:title: 115 HR 3562 IH: Forest Service Flexible Housing Partnerships Act of 2023
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Neguse introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Agriculture, and in addition to the Committee on Natural Resources, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

form.official-title: To amend the Agriculture Improvement Act of 2018 to reauthorize Forest Service flexible partnerships.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Forest Service Flexible Housing Partnerships Act of 2023.

paragraph.text: housing is a challenge nationwide, especially in areas within or adjacent to forests; and
the Forest Service is a critical partner in addressing housing needs for—

subparagraph.text: individuals in areas described in paragraph (1); and

section.header: Authorization for lease of Forest Service sites
section.text: Section 8623 of the Agriculture Improvement Act of 2018 (16 U.S.C. 580d note; Public Law 115–334) is amended—

paragraph.text: in subsection (a)(2)(D), by striking dwelling; and inserting dwelling or multiunit dwelling;;

clause.text: in subclause (I), by inserting such as housing, after improvements,;
in subclause (II), by striking and at the end;
in subclause (III), by striking or at the end and inserting and; and
by adding at the end the following:

subclause.text: services occurring off of the administrative site—

subitem.text: occur on the unit of the National Forest System in which the administrative site is located; or
benefit the National Forest System; and

item.text: that support activities occurring within the unit of the National Forest System in which the administrative site is located; or

subparagraph.text: by adding at the end the following:
The term of a lease of an administrative site under this section shall be up to 100 years.

A lease of an administrative site under this section shall include a provision for renewal of the lease if the use of the administrative site, at the time of renewal, is in accordance with this section.

paragraph.text: in subsection (i), by striking 2023 each place it appears and inserting 2028.
